intro: Urera cameroonensis var. laurentii, commonly known as the Cameroon urera, is a tropical plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. It has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
